docblock.description: SQL Transaction controller class.
docblock.long-description: This class is intended simulate nested transactions using a single transaction.

docblock.description: Starts a new transaction if no transaction already started.
docblock.long-description: Otherwise, simulates a nested transaction through a single transaction.

docblock.description: Ends the current transaction (COMMIT or ROLLBACK according errors).
docblock.long-description: If nested, the transaction is not COMMITed until the last top-level transaction is ended.

tag.name: throw
tag.description: Throw an exception if exceptions occured

docblock.description: Shorthand for execute_model()
Returns the last execute() insert id.
docblock.long-description: Returns null if no last insert id available.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The insert id of the last execute().

docblock.description: Model base class.
docblock.long-description: Responsibilities: - deal with database transactions

docblock.description: This property is set in the constructor.
docblock.long-description: Name of the main table: i.e. the table affected by the default put(),post(),delete() methods (if not overriden).

docblock.description: This property is set in the constructor.
docblock.long-description: Name of the model (eg. a class name 'SomeModel' becomes 'my').

docblock.description: Params to fields mapping.
docblock.long-description:
This mapping purpose is to abstract table fields names.

array(
    'id' => 'id',
    'name' => 'name',
    'example_name' => 'another_name_in_table',
    'shortname' => 'name_in_table'
)

docblock.description: Fields validation definitions.
docblock.long-description:
This validation puropose is to use the xValidator classes to ease models validation code. Also, these can be reused in xForm validation definition.

array(
    'name' => array(
        'mandatory',
        'string' => array(2, 50)
    )
);

docblock.description: The primary key field names (model field names, defaults to 'id').
Fields (model) that accept sql constants (e.g.
docblock.long-description:
CURRENT_TIMESTAMP). These fields value, when provided with a mysql constant or function, will not be escaped and enquoted. If empty, any field will accept sql constants. Example array:

array('mapping_name')

docblock.description: Mandatory params for get operations (model fields names)
Mandatory params for post operations (model fields names)
Mandatory params for put operations (model fields names)
Mandatory params for delete operations (model fields names)
Fields to return (model fields names).
docblock.long-description: Contains db fields name(s). This property will be overridden with the xreturn parameter value.

docblock.description: Available SQL joins.
docblock.long-description:
Joins MUST must match 0..1 tuple at most. Array example:

array(
   'foreign_model_name' => 'LEFT JOIN foreign_table_name ON this_table_id = foreign_table_id'
)

docblock.description: Enabled SQL joins.
docblock.long-description: Contains model name(s). This property will be overridden with the xjoin parameter value.

docblock.description: Available SQL where templates.
docblock.long-description:
Conventions: - {modelfield} substitutes the value given for this field - [modelfield] substitutes database field name corresponding to modelfield Array example:

array(
   'where_name1' => "dbfield1 = {modelfield1} AND (dbfield3 > {modelfield3} OR dbfield4 IN {modelfield4})",
   'where_name2' => "{{field1}} = {field1} AND {{field2}} = {field2} OR {{field3}} LIKE {field3})",
   'where_name3' => "{{foreign_id}} = {foreign_id} AND (0=1 [OR {{*}} LIKE {*}])"
)

docblock.description: Enabled SQL where template.
docblock.long-description: Contains where template name(s). This property will be overridden with the xwhere parameter value.

docblock.description: Result sorting fields (model fields names).
docblock.long-description: Contains model fields name(s). This property will be overridden with the xorder_by parameter value.

docblock.description: Result sorting order.
docblock.long-description: Accepted values: 'ASC' or 'DESC'. This property will be overridden with the xorder parameter value.

docblock.description: Result group by.
docblock.long-description: Contains model fields name(s). This property will be overridden with the xgroup_by parameter value.

docblock.description: Specifies which of the fields accept HTML.
docblock.long-description:
Example:

array(
    'field-1' => null,         // Allows all HTML tags
    'field-2' => '

' // Allows a set of tags, strips others
)

docblock.description: Model classes should only be instanciated through the Model::load() method.
Loads and returns the model specified object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The model to load. e.g. item will load the models/item.php file and return an instance of the ItemModel class.

docblock.description: Scans and returns available models.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of available models (filename => modelname).

docblock.description: Returns the database field name from the given model field name.
docblock.long-description: If the database field is not mapped, returns the given database field name. FIXME: foreign models fieldnames are not translated. This might cause problems in eg. sql_where()?

tag.name: param
tag.description: The model field name, or the database field name if not mapped.

docblock.description: Returns the model field name from the given database field name.
docblock.long-description: FIXME: foreign models fieldnames are not translated. This might cause problems in eg. sql_where()?

docblock.description: Returns the primary key model field name

tag.name: return
tag.description: Name of the model id field.

docblock.description: Returns an associative array contanining params values with translated keys (e.g.
docblock.long-description:
keys reflect the db fields names). Return array structure:

array(
    'db_fieldname_1' => array(
        'value' => 'some value',
        'wildcard' => false
     ),
     'db_fieldname_2' => array(
        'value' => '%some value%',
        'wildcard' => true
     ),
     ...
)
  • Only mapped fields are taken into account.
  • Wildcard filters patterns are applied to params values if applicable.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If true, applies the filters pattern be applied to value

docblock.description: Returns an array of modelfield => value containing the subset of fields that belong to the given foreign model name.
docblock.long-description: FIXME: are the fieldnames translated (eg. reflect the db field names?) To be consistent with fields_values, they should be translated.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The foreign model(s) name(s). If not given, uses the current $join property value.

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to return fields with their model name as a prefix (defaults to false).

docblock.description: Returns the foreign models mapping according the xjoin defined in parameters.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If defined, the returned mapping is limited to specified models.

docblock.description: Checks given params values and returns an array containing the invalid params (fields) as key, and true as value.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If given, limits validation to the given $fields. {@see xValidatorStore::invalids()}

docblock.description: Implements the REST get method to access data.
docblock.long-description: Issues a SELECT and returns the result as an associative array.

docblock.description: Implements the REST post method to access data.
docblock.long-description: Issues a UPDATE and returns the result as an associative array.

docblock.description: Implements the REST put method to access data.
docblock.long-description: Issues a INSERT and returns the result as an associative array.

docblock.description: Implements the REST delete method to access data.
docblock.long-description: Issues a DELETE and returns the result as an associative array.

docblock.description: Issues a COUNT and returns the result
Returns an array of active joins.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Joins to use. If not given, uses the current $join property value.

docblock.description: Returns the given value, escaped and quoted.
docblock.long-description: If the field name (modelfield) is given and the field is listed in self::constants array, and the value is a sql constant, returns the value unquoted and unescaped.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to escape and enquote

docblock.description: Returns the allowed SQL constants (eg.
docblock.long-description: CURRENT_TIMESTAMP).

docblock.description: Returns a default SQL SELECT clause.
Returns a default SQL FROM clause.
Creates a structured where clause content array.
docblock.long-description:
array(
    array(
        'operator' => 'AND',
        'comparator' => '=',
        'table' => 'tablename',
        'field' => 'fieldname',
        'value' => 'somevalue', // or array('value1', 'value2', ...)
    )
);

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to consider primary key field(s) only

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to consider local fields only (ignoring foreign tables fields)

docblock.description: Returns a default SQL WHERE clause.
Returns a default SQL JOIN clause to be used as a join.
Returns a default SQL ORDER clause.
Returns a default SQL GROUP BY clause.
Returns default SQL LIMIT and/or OFFSET clause(s).
Exectues the given sql and returns its query result.
docblock.long-description:
• If the result is empty, an empty array is returned.
    • If the result is not empty, an 2 dimensional associative array with mapped array keys containing the result rows is returned.
    • If the query didn't return row results (e.g. insert, update and delete queries), an informational array is returned, containg
    • the last insert id,
    • the number of affected rows,
    • additional mysql information,
    • and the raw mysql result.

docblock.description: This component is to be used for transforming field(s) value(s).
Array of created xValidator instances.
Parameters (values) to validate
Instanciate a new xValidatorStore, creating xValidator instances from the given $options

tag.description: An array containing validators fieldname => options: array( 'name' => array( 'mandatory', 'string' => array(2, 50) ), 'birthyear' => array( 'integer' => array(1900, 2012) ) )

tag.description: An array of fieldname => value to validate: array( 'name' => 'King Luis', 'birthyear' => '08/04/1901' )

docblock.description: Returns the given validator.

tag.name: return

docblock.description: Returns an array containing field => message for each invalid field.

docblock.description: Generic validator.
Validation options (e.g.
docblock.long-description: string min/max length)

docblock.description: Returns an instance of the given $validator initialized with the given optional $options.
Returns a user message if the valid is invalid, or returns false if the value is valid.
Returns the validator message.
docblock.long-description: Used to initialize the validator message and must be implemented in child classes.

tag.name: note
tag.description: Validator message have to be defined here in order to be able to use the _() function.

docblock.description: This validator is made for re-using models validation logic
Generic regular expression based validator
Checks whether a value is present or not
Checks whether an email pattern is correct
Checks whether a url pattern is correct
Checks the minimum length of a string
Checks the maximum length of a string
Checks whether a value is an integer
Checks whether a value is a valid date
Tells whether the given time is valid
Checks whether a value is a valid time
Tells whether the given time is valid
Checks whether a value is a valid datetime
Checks whether an integer value is equal or greater than a given value
Checks whether an integer value is equal or less than a given value
Checks whether two fields values are identical
Checks whether a checkbox is checked
Checks whether a value does not already exists in a table row

Return the last called page url if applicable, otherwise returns the site root page
Add/retrieve messages in the web messages stack.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Depending on the expected result: - The message to display - If false, the messages stack is returned as an array. - If not defined or null, the messages stack is returned as an array and the stack is reset.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of the message to add to the stack (ignored if $text is not a string). - The value depends on the CSS you're using (eg. bootstrap.css: http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/components.html#alerts), - If null, the view that parses and displays messages should decide of a $type.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Depending on the given arguments: - Null if $text is given, - An array containing the stored messages if $text is empty.

docblock.description: This class contains utility functions.
Prevents class instanciation.
Filesystem: copies the given source to the given destination, using the given options.
docblock.long-description: Useful for recursive file copy.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options (defaults to 'rf'), valid options are: - r: recursive - f: force

docblock.description: Filesystem: removes the given location Useful for non-empty directory removal.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The location (file or directory) to remove.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options (defaults to 'rf'), valid options are: - r: recursive - f: force

docblock.description: Filesystem: Returns all absolute file names with the given $extension contained in the given $dir (recursive lookup).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The extension of the file (e.g. php).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of initial filenames (optional, used for recursive calls).

docblock.description: Make sure the given value is an array by returning an array of the given value.
docblock.long-description: If the given value is NULL, returns an empty array. If the given value is a scalar, returns an array containing the value. If the given value is already an array, returns the given value without transformation.

docblock.description: Merges arrays recursively, replacing existing keys.
docblock.long-description:
Priority is given to the last given array parameter.

Careful: This algorythm differs from PHP array_merge_recursive in the sense that merging array with same-level-same-keyname will remain unique when using xUtil::array_merge().

Merge example:

print_r(xUtil::array_merge(array(
    'Index content',
    'assoc' => array(
        'a_key' => 'a_content',
        'b_key' => 'b_content',
        '2nd level index content'
    ),
    array(
        'key' => 'value'
    ),
    'this-key' => 'remains-unique',
), array(
    'assoc' => array(
        'a_key' => 'a_content_modified',
        'c_key' => 'c_content',
    ),
    array(
        'key' => 'value'
    ),
    'Index content 2',
    'this-key' => 'remains-unique'
)));

will output:

Array
(
    [0] => Index content
    [assoc] => Array
        (
            [a_key] => a_content_modified
            [b_key] => b_content
            [0] => 2nd level index content
            [c_key] => c_content
        )

    [1] => Array
        (
            [key] => value
        )

    [2] => Array
        (
            [key] => value
        )

   [3] => Index content 2
   [this-key] => remains-unique
)

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Write unit tests (use the above example for one of the tests).

docblock.description: Returns a deep clone of the given array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The clone of the given array.

docblock.description: Filters and returns the given array, keeping only the given keys.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If true, the filter is inverted. Defaults to false.

docblock.description: Returns true if the given needle(s) exist in the given haystack.
docblock.long-description: Note that multiple needles can be given.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Needle(s). Multiple needles can be provided within a array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: And search. False to perform an OR search (default), true to perform an AND search.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Strict. True to also check types.

docblock.description: Returns the last class called, null if last call is not a class.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The name of the last called class (null if not a class)

docblock.description: Returns the last function called, null if last call is not a function.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The name of the last called class (null if not a class)

docblock.description: Returns the given $string with HTML tags stripped, preserving null value for $string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string (or array of string) to strip.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Allowable HTML tags (those will not be stripped).

tag.name: return
tag.description: The stripped string (or array is $string is an array).

docblock.description: Returns the given $text trimmed to $max_characters, taking care not to truncate words.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optionnal suffix to append if text was trimmed.

docblock.description: Issues cross-browser header for page redirection.
Returns document root relative url with the given url suffix.
docblock.long-description:
Example: the following code returns '/path/to/site/some_controller/some_action'

print url('some_controller/some_action');

tag.name: param
tag.description: If true, prepends protocol and hostname to the url

docblock.description: Returns the current full url.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If true (default), query string is appended to returned url. If false,no query string is appended to returned url. If an array, the given associative array is merged into the current query string. If a string, the given query string is used as is.

docblock.description: Returns the extension of the given file.
Returns an array containing date components from a ISO/US date.
docblock.long-description: Useful for parsing mysql date fields values.

docblock.description: Returns a timestamp from a ISO/US date.
docblock.long-description: Useful for parsing mysql date fields values.

docblock.description: Base controller class with web niceties.
docblock.long-description: Deals with caller interactions (request & response).

docblock.description: Controller instance metadata (associative array).
Convenience method for merging this instance metadata with additional metadata.
docblock.long-description: The given metadata will erase this instance metadata. The merged metadata array replaces this instance metadata and is also returned. Metadata name format can be: - plain: eg. somename - hirearchic: eg. some/meta/name, which will result in an array('some' => array('meta' => array('name' => $contents)))

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Mandatory if 1st param is a string) The metadata contents.

docblock.description: Save/retrieve value(s) in controller session.
docblock.long-description: Parameter behave as follows: - If only key param given, the corresponding stored value is returned (null if key does not exist) - If both key and value are given, the value is stored in session. - If no argument given, return the session array of the controller.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to store. If null or not provided, the

tag.name: return
tag.description: - The stored session array for the controller if $key is not provided or null - The stored value if a valid key is given without value.

docblock.description: Whether in-memory modifications to configuration data are allowed
Iteration index
Number of elements in configuration data
Contains array of configuration data
Used when unsetting values during iteration to ensure we do not skip the next element
Contains which config file sections were loaded.
docblock.long-description: This is null if all sections were loaded, a string name if one section is loaded and an array of string names if multiple sections were loaded.

docblock.description: This is used to track section inheritance.
docblock.long-description: The keys are names of sections that extend other sections, and the values are the extended sections.

docblock.description: Load file error string.
docblock.long-description: Is null if there was no error while file loading

docblock.description: xZend_Config provides a property based interface to an array.
docblock.long-description:
The data are read-only unless $allowModifications is set to true on construction.

xZend_Config also implements Countable and Iterator to facilitate easy access to the data.

docblock.description: Retrieve a value and return $default if there is no element set.
Magic function so that $obj->value will work.
Only allow setting of a property if $allowModifications was set to true on construction.
docblock.long-description: Otherwise, throw an exception.

docblock.description: Deep clone of this instance to ensure that nested xZend_Configs are also cloned.
Return an associative array of the stored data.
Support isset() overloading on PHP 5.1
Support unset() overloading on PHP 5.1
Defined by Countable interface
Defined by Iterator interface
Defined by Iterator interface
Defined by Iterator interface
Defined by Iterator interface
Defined by Iterator interface
Returns the section name(s) loaded.
Returns true if all sections were loaded
Merge another xZend_Config with this one.
docblock.long-description: The items in $merge will override the same named items in the current config.

docblock.description: Prevent any more modifications being made to this instance.
docblock.long-description: Useful after merge() has been used to merge multiple xZend_Config objects into one object which should then not be modified again.

docblock.description: Returns if this xZend_Config object is read only or not.
Get the current extends
Set an extend for xZend_Config_Writer
Throws an exception if $extendingSection may not extend $extendedSection, and tracks the section extension if it is valid.
Handle any errors from simplexml_load_file or parse_ini_file
Merge two arrays recursively, overwriting keys of the same name in $firstArray with the value in $secondArray.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Second array to merge into first array

docblock.description: String that separates nesting levels of configuration data identifiers
String that separates the parent section name
Whether to skip extends or not
Loads the section $section from the config file $filename for access facilitated by nested object properties.
docblock.long-description:
If the section name contains a ":" then the section name to the right is loaded and included into the properties. Note that the keys in this $section will override any keys of the same name in the sections that have been included via ":".

If the $section is null, then all sections in the ini file are loaded.

If any key includes a ".", then this will act as a separator to create a sub-property.

example ini file: [all] db.connection = database hostname = live

 [staging : all]
 hostname = staging

after calling $data = new xZend_Config_Ini($file, 'staging'); then $data->hostname === "staging" $data->db->connection === "database"

The $options parameter may be provided as either a boolean or an array. If provided as a boolean, this sets the $allowModifications option of xZend_Config. If provided as an array, there are two configuration directives that may be set. For example:

$options = array( 'allowModifications' => false, 'nestSeparator' => '->' );

docblock.description: Load the INI file from disk using parse_ini_file().
docblock.long-description: Use a private error handler to convert any loading errors into a xException

docblock.description: Load the ini file and preprocess the section separator (':' in the section name (that is used for section extension) so that the resultant array has the correct section names and the extension information is stored in a sub-key called ';extends'.
docblock.long-description: We use ';extends' as this can never be a valid key name in an INI file that has been loaded using parse_ini_file().

docblock.description: Process each element in the section and handle the ";extends" inheritance key.
docblock.long-description: Passes control to _processKey() to handle the nest separator sub-property syntax that may be used within the key name.

docblock.description: Assign the key's value to the property list.
docblock.long-description: Handles the nest separator for sub-properties.

docblock.description: Manages HTTP Requests routing.

One a route has been matched, this property is set with the route information.
Generated params from route config, route arguments and post/get params.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A rails-like route pattern, made of: - static keywords (e.g. somekeyword) - variable parameters, those will be set as parameters assigned with the route fragment value when calling the controller (e.g. :aparameter) Example: /somekeyword/:controller/:action/:page

docblock.description: Calls controller action and outputs HTTP response body.

docblock.description: Controllers and actions to exlude from sitemap.
docblock.long-description:
Note: Controller and actions names must be lowercase. Structure convention:

array (
    'controller_name_1' => true, // Excude this controller from sitemap
    'controller_name_2' => array(
        'action_1', // Exclude action_1 from sitemap
        'action_2'  // Exclude action_2 from sitemap
    )
)

docblock.description: Controllers custom titles for sitemap Conventions: array ( 'controller_name_1' => _('Custom Title 1'), 'controller_name_2' => _('Custom Title 2') )

docblock.description: Base view class.
docblock.long-description: Responsibilities - deals with rendering and internationalization (i18n)

docblock.description: Template data (associative array).
docblock.long-description:
This data will be made available inside the template file. The conventional array structure is as follows:

array(
    items => array(
        array(id => '0', what => 'Items cell contains the associative array'),
        array(id => '1', what => 'of data to display, usually retrieved'),
        array(id => '2', what => 'from the database.')
    )
    html => array(
        // Arbitrary HTML code to insert in the view
        myview => 'HTML code generated by some other view, i.e. myview'
    ),
    messages => array(
        'failed' => true
    ),
    form => array(
        // Typically: form data to latch, i.e. the value of the name input of the posted form
        name => 'The value for the `name` field of the form inside the view',
        user => 'The value for the `user` field of the form inside the view'
    ),
    invalids => array(
        // Typically: to be displayed form validation error message for each invalid form field
        name => 'The error message for the `name`field, e.g. The name is too short',
        user => 'e.g. This username is already taken'
    ),
    paging => array(
        // Paging context informations
        current => 'The current page of the paging context',
        first => 'The first page number of the paging context',
        last => 'The last page number of the paging context',
        total => 'The total number of results of the paging context'
    ),
    misc => array(
        // Whatever miscellaneous, view specific information
        somekey => 'some value'
    )
)

docblock.description: Metadata for the view (associative array).
docblock.long-description:
Used for building html head metadata and links (css and javascript). The conventional array structure is as follows:

array(
    title => 'Some title',
    keywords => 'html,meta,keywords,comma,separated',
    css => array(
        'css/main.css',
        array('css/print.css', 'print')
    ),
    js => array(
        'js/file.js'
    ),
    related => array(
        content_id_1 => 'Some HTML content to be displayed in the layout'
    ),
    navigation => array(
        highlight => 'Id of the main navigation item to highligh'
    )
)

docblock.description: The View subclass directory.
docblock.long-description: Necessary because PHP is not yet able to provide with the directory of a subclass within the parent class code.

docblock.description: Computed view tpl name, used for rendering the default template if view PHP class does not exist.
A buffer for buffering view output.
An optionnal view to be used to embed this view.
docblock.long-description: Must the name of a view (as defined in @see xView::load()).

docblock.description: View classes can only be instanciated through the View::load() method.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of data to be merged to the view instance

docblock.description: Hook for subclass initialization logic
Loads and returns the view specified object.
docblock.long-description:
For example, the following code will load the views/entry/item.php file. and return an instance of the EntryItemView class:

xView::load('entry/item');

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of data to be merged to the view instance

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of metadata on which the view metadata will be merged

docblock.description: Convenience method for merging this instance metadata with additional metadata.
docblock.long-description: The given metadata will erase this instance metadata. The merged metadata array replaces this instance metadata and is also returned.

docblock.description: Convenience method for merging this instance data with additional data.
docblock.long-description: The given data will erase this instance data. The merged data array replaces this instance data and is also returned.

docblock.description: Renders the given template with the given data.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The filename of the template to use (e.g. tplfile.tpl).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data to be used within the template context. (defaults to instance data property).

docblock.description: Buffers the given string in the view buffer.
Shorthand method for {@link buffer()}.
Retrun rendered view.
docblock.long-description: This method should be overridden in subclasses to override the default tpl rendering.

docblock.description: Allows to echo() or print() a xView instance.

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file View/View.php
No DocBlock was found for function \u()
Argument $meta is missing from the Docblock of apply()
